ListAPIKeys.description: List all API keys available for your account.

CreateAPIKey.request_schema_description: Request used to create an API key.

UpdateAPIKey.request_schema_description: Request used to update an API key.

ListApplicationKeys.description: List all application keys available for your org

GetApplicationKey.description: Get an application key for your org.

UpdateApplicationKey.request_schema_description: Request used to update an application key.

ListCurrentUserApplicationKeys.description: List all application keys available for current user
ListCurrentUserApplicationKeys.summary: Get all application keys owned by current user

CreateCurrentUserApplicationKey.description: Create an application key for current user
CreateCurrentUserApplicationKey.summary: Create an application key for current user
CreateCurrentUserApplicationKey.request_schema_description: Request used to create an application key.

DeleteCurrentUserApplicationKey.description: Delete an application key owned by current user
DeleteCurrentUserApplicationKey.summary: Delete an application key owned by current user

GetCurrentUserApplicationKey.description: Get an application key owned by current user
GetCurrentUserApplicationKey.summary: Get one application key owned by current user

UpdateCurrentUserApplicationKey.description: Edit an application key owned by current user
UpdateCurrentUserApplicationKey.summary: Edit an application key owned by current user
UpdateCurrentUserApplicationKey.request_schema_description: Request used to update an application key.

DeleteDashboardListItems.description: Delete dashboards from an existing dashboard list.
DeleteDashboardListItems.summary: Delete items from a dashboard list
DeleteDashboardListItems.request_description: Dashboards to delete from the dashboard list.
DeleteDashboardListItems.request_schema_description: Request containing a list of dashboards to delete.

GetDashboardListItems.description: Fetch the dashboard list’s dashboard definitions.
GetDashboardListItems.summary: Get items of a Dashboard List

CreateDashboardListItems.description: Add dashboards to an existing dashboard list.
CreateDashboardListItems.summary: Add Items to a Dashboard List
CreateDashboardListItems.request_description: Dashboards to add to the dashboard list.
CreateDashboardListItems.request_schema_description: Request containing a list of dashboards to add.

UpdateDashboardListItems.description: Update dashboards of an existing dashboard list.
UpdateDashboardListItems.summary: Update items of a dashboard list
UpdateDashboardListItems.request_description: New dashboards of the dashboard list.
UpdateDashboardListItems.request_schema_description: Request containing the list of dashboards to update to.

ListIncidents.description: Get all incidents for the user's organization.

DeleteIncident.description: Deletes an existing incident from the users organization.

GetIncident.description: Get the details of an incident by `incident_id`.
GetIncident.summary: Get the details of an incident

UpdateIncident.description: Updates an incident. Provide only the attributes that should be updated as this request is a partial update.

SubmitLog.description:
Send your logs to your Datadog platform over HTTP. Limits per HTTP request are:

- Maximum content size per payload (uncompressed): 5MB
- Maximum size for a single log: 1MB
- Maximum array size if sending multiple logs in an array: 1000 entries

Any log exceeding 1MB is accepted and truncated by Datadog:
- For a single log request, the API truncates the log at 1MB and returns a 2xx.
- For a multi-logs request, the API processes all logs, truncates only logs larger than 1MB, and returns a 2xx.

Datadog recommends sending your logs compressed.
Add the `Content-Encoding: gzip` header to the request when sending compressed logs.

The status codes answered by the HTTP API are:
- 202: Accepted: the request has been accepted for processing
- 400: Bad request (likely an issue in the payload formatting)
- 401: Unauthorized (likely a missing API Key)
- 403: Permission issue (likely using an invalid API Key)
- 408: Request Timeout, request should be retried after some time
- 413: Payload too large (batch is above 5MB uncompressed)
- 429: Too Many Requests, request should be retried after some time
- 500: Internal Server Error, the server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request, request should be retried after some time
- 503: Service Unavailable, the server is not ready to handle the request probably because it is overloaded, request should be retried after some time

AggregateLogs.description: The API endpoint to aggregate events into buckets and compute metrics and timeseries.
AggregateLogs.request_schema_description: The object sent with the request to retrieve a list of logs from your organization.

GetLogsArchiveOrder.description:
Get the current order of your archives.
This endpoint takes no JSON arguments.

UpdateLogsArchiveOrder.description:
Update the order of your archives. Since logs are processed sequentially, reordering an archive may change
the structure and content of the data processed by other archives.

**Note**: Using the `PUT` method updates your archive's order by replacing the current order
with the new one.
UpdateLogsArchiveOrder.request_description: An object containing the new ordered list of archive IDs.
UpdateLogsArchiveOrder.request_schema_description: A ordered list of archive IDs.

ListLogsArchives.description: Get the list of configured logs archives with their definitions.

CreateLogsArchive.description: Create an archive in your organization.
CreateLogsArchive.request_description: The definition of the new archive.

DeleteLogsArchive.description: Delete a given archive from your organization.

GetLogsArchive.description: Get a specific archive from your organization.

UpdateLogsArchive.description:
Update a given archive configuration.

**Note**: Using this method updates your archive configuration by **replacing**
your current configuration with the new one sent to your Datadog organization.

RemoveRoleFromArchive.description: Removes a role from an archive. ([Roles API](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v2/roles/))

ListArchiveReadRoles.description: Returns all read roles a given archive is restricted to.
ListArchiveReadRoles.summary: List read roles for an archive

AddReadRoleToArchive.description: Adds a read role to an archive. ([Roles API](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v2/roles/))

ListLogsMetrics.description: Get the list of configured log-based metrics with their definitions.

CreateLogsMetric.description:
Create a metric based on your ingested logs in your organization.
Returns the log-based metric object from the request body when the request is successful.
CreateLogsMetric.request_description: The definition of the new log-based metric.

DeleteLogsMetric.description: Delete a specific log-based metric from your organization.

GetLogsMetric.description: Get a specific log-based metric from your organization.

UpdateLogsMetric.description:
Update a specific log-based metric from your organization.
Returns the log-based metric object from the request body when the request is successful.
UpdateLogsMetric.request_description: New definition of the log-based metric.

ListRestrictionQueries.description: Returns all restriction queries, including their names and IDs.

CreateRestrictionQuery.description: Create a new restriction query for your organization.

GetRoleRestrictionQuery.description: Get restriction query for a given role.
GetRoleRestrictionQuery.summary: Get restriction query for a given role

ListUserRestrictionQueries.description: Get all restriction queries for a given user.
ListUserRestrictionQueries.summary: Get all restriction queries for a given user

GetRestrictionQuery.description: Get a restriction query in the organization specified by the restriction query's `restriction_query_id`.

RemoveRoleFromRestrictionQuery.description: Removes a role from a restriction query.
RemoveRoleFromRestrictionQuery.summary: Revoke role from a restriction query

ListRestrictionQueryRoles.description: Returns all roles that have a given restriction query.
ListRestrictionQueryRoles.summary: List roles for a restriction query

AddRoleToRestrictionQuery.description: Adds a role to a restriction query.
AddRoleToRestrictionQuery.summary: Grant role to a restriction query

ListLogsGet.description:
List endpoint returns logs that match a log search query.
[Results are paginated][1].

Use this endpoint to see your latest logs.

**If you are considering archiving logs for your organization,
consider use of the Datadog archive capabilities instead of the log list API.
See [Datadog Logs Archive documentation][2].**

[1]: /logs/guide/collect-multiple-logs-with-pagination
[2]: https://docs.datadoghq.com/logs/archives

ListLogs.description:
List endpoint returns logs that match a log search query.
[Results are paginated][1].

Use this endpoint to build complex logs filtering and search.

**If you are considering archiving logs for your organization,
consider use of the Datadog archive capabilities instead of the log list API.
See [Datadog Logs Archive documentation][2].**

[1]: /logs/guide/collect-multiple-logs-with-pagination
[2]: https://docs.datadoghq.com/logs/archives
ListLogs.request_schema_description: The request for a logs list.

ListTagConfigurations.description:
Returns all configured count/gauge/rate/distribution metric names
(with additional filters if specified).

ListTagsByMetricName.description: View indexed tag key-value pairs for a given metric name.

DeleteTagConfiguration.description:
Deletes a metric's tag configuration. Can only be used with application
keys from users with the `Manage Tags for Metrics` permission.

ListTagConfigurationByName.description: Returns the tag configuration for the given metric name.

UpdateTagConfiguration.description:
Update the tag configuration of a metric or percentile aggregations of a distribution metric or custom aggregations
of a count, rate, or gauge metric.
Can only be used with application keys from users with the `Manage Tags for Metrics` permission.
UpdateTagConfiguration.request_schema_description: Request object that includes the metric that you would like to edit the tag configuration on.

CreateTagConfiguration.description:
Create and define a list of queryable tag keys for an existing count/gauge/rate/distribution metric.
Optionally, include percentile aggregations on any distribution metric or configure custom aggregations
on any count, rate, or gauge metric.
Can only be used with application keys of users with the `Manage Tags for Metrics` permission.
CreateTagConfiguration.request_schema_description: Request object that includes the metric that you would like to configure tags for.

ListVolumesByMetricName.description:
View distinct metrics volumes for the given metric name.

Custom distribution metrics will return both ingested and indexed custom metric volumes.
For Metrics without Limits™ beta customers, all metrics will return both ingested/indexed volumes.
Custom metrics generated in-app from other products will return `null` for ingested volumes.
ListVolumesByMetricName.summary: List distinct metric volumes by metric name

ListPermissions.description: Returns a list of all permissions, including name, description, and ID.

ListProcesses.description: Get all processes for your organization.

ListRoles.description: Returns all roles, including their names and IDs.

CreateRole.description: Create a new role for your organization.

GetRole.description: Get a role in the organization specified by the role’s `role_id`.

UpdateRole.description: Edit a role. Can only be used with application keys belonging to administrators.

CloneRole.summary: Create a new role by cloning an existing role
CloneRole.request_schema_description: Request to create a role by cloning an existing role.

RemovePermissionFromRole.description: Removes a permission from a role.

ListRolePermissions.description: Returns a list of all permissions for a single role.

AddPermissionToRole.description: Adds a permission to a role.

RemoveUserFromRole.description: Removes a user from a role.
RemoveUserFromRole.summary: Remove a user from a role

ListRoleUsers.description: Gets all users of a role.
ListRoleUsers.summary: Get all users of a role

AddUserToRole.description: Adds a user to a role.
AddUserToRole.summary: Add a user to a role

DownloadCloudWorkloadPolicyFile.description:
The download endpoint generates a Cloud Workload Security policy file from your currently active
Cloud Workload Security rules, and downloads them as a .policy file. This file can then be deployed to
your agents to update the policy running in your environment.
DownloadCloudWorkloadPolicyFile.summary: Get the latest Cloud Workload Security policy

ListCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRules.description: Get the list of Agent rules.
ListCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRules.summary: Get all Cloud Workload Security Agent rules

CreateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.description: Create a new Agent rule with the given parameters.
CreateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.summary: Create a Cloud Workload Security Agent rule
CreateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.request_description: The definition of the new Agent rule.
CreateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.request_schema_description: Request object that includes the Agent rule to create.

DeleteCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.summary: Delete a Cloud Workload Security Agent rule

GetCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.description: Get the details of a specific Agent rule.
GetCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.summary: Get a Cloud Workload Security Agent rule

UpdateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.description:
Update a specific Agent rule.
Returns the Agent rule object when the request is successful.
UpdateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.summary: Update a Cloud Workload Security Agent rule
UpdateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.request_description: New definition of the Agent rule.
UpdateCloudWorkloadSecurityAgentRule.request_schema_description: Request object that includes the Agent rule with the attributes to update.

ListSecurityFilters.description: Get the list of configured security filters with their definitions.

CreateSecurityFilter.description:
Create a security filter.

See the [security filter guide](https://docs.datadoghq.com/security_platform/guide/how-to-setup-security-filters-using-security-monitoring-api/)
for more examples.
CreateSecurityFilter.request_description: The definition of the new security filter.
CreateSecurityFilter.request_schema_description: Request object that includes the security filter that you would like to create.

GetSecurityFilter.description:
Get the details of a specific security filter.

See the [security filter guide](https://docs.datadoghq.com/security_platform/guide/how-to-setup-security-filters-using-security-monitoring-api/)
for more examples.

UpdateSecurityFilter.description:
Update a specific security filter.
Returns the security filter object when the request is successful.
UpdateSecurityFilter.request_description: New definition of the security filter.

DeleteSecurityMonitoringRule.description: Delete an existing rule. Default rules cannot be deleted.

UpdateSecurityMonitoringRule.description:
Update an existing rule. When updating `cases`, `queries` or `options`, the whole field
must be included. For example, when modifying a query all queries must be included.
Default rules can only be updated to be enabled and to change notifications.

ListSecurityMonitoringSignals.description:
The list endpoint returns security signals that match a search query.
Both this endpoint and the POST endpoint can be used interchangeably when listing
security signals.
ListSecurityMonitoringSignals.summary: Get a quick list of security signals

SearchSecurityMonitoringSignals.description:
Returns security signals that match a search query.
Both this endpoint and the GET endpoint can be used interchangeably for listing
security signals.
SearchSecurityMonitoringSignals.summary: Get a list of security signals
SearchSecurityMonitoringSignals.request_schema_description: The request for a security signal list.

CreateServiceAccount.description: Create a service account for your organization.

ListServiceAccountApplicationKeys.description: List all application keys available for this service account.
ListServiceAccountApplicationKeys.summary: List application keys for this service account

CreateServiceAccountApplicationKey.description: Create an application key for this service account.
CreateServiceAccountApplicationKey.summary: Create an application key for this service account
CreateServiceAccountApplicationKey.request_schema_description: Request used to create an application key.

DeleteServiceAccountApplicationKey.description: Delete an application key owned by this service account.
DeleteServiceAccountApplicationKey.summary: Delete an application key for this service account

GetServiceAccountApplicationKey.description: Get an application key owned by this service account.
GetServiceAccountApplicationKey.summary: Get one application key for this service account

UpdateServiceAccountApplicationKey.description: Edit an application key owned by this service account.
UpdateServiceAccountApplicationKey.summary: Edit an application key for this service account
UpdateServiceAccountApplicationKey.request_schema_description: Request used to update an application key.

ListIncidentServices.description: Get all incident services uploaded for the requesting user's organization. If the `include[users]` query parameter is provided, the included attribute will contain the users related to these incident services.
ListIncidentServices.summary: Get a list of all incident services

CreateIncidentService.request_schema_description: Create request with an incident service payload.

GetIncidentService.description:
Get details of an incident service. If the `include[users]` query parameter is provided,
the included attribute will contain the users related to these incident services.
GetIncidentService.summary: Get details of an incident service

UpdateIncidentService.description: Updates an existing incident service. Only provide the attributes which should be updated as this request is a partial update.
UpdateIncidentService.request_schema_description: Update request with an incident service payload.

ListIncidentTeams.description: Get all incident teams for the requesting user's organization. If the `include[users]` query parameter is provided, the included attribute will contain the users related to these incident teams.
ListIncidentTeams.summary: Get a list of all incident teams

CreateIncidentTeam.request_schema_description: Create request with an incident team payload.

GetIncidentTeam.description:
Get details of an incident team. If the `include[users]` query parameter is provided,
the included attribute will contain the users related to these incident teams.
GetIncidentTeam.summary: Get details of an incident team

UpdateIncidentTeam.description: Updates an existing incident team. Only provide the attributes which should be updated as this request is a partial update.
UpdateIncidentTeam.request_schema_description: Update request with an incident team payload.

SendInvitations.description: Sends emails to one or more users inviting them to join the organization.
SendInvitations.request_schema_description: Object to invite users to join the organization.

GetInvitation.description: Returns a single user invitation by its UUID.

ListUsers.description:
Get the list of all users in the organization. This list includes
all users even if they are deactivated or unverified.

CreateUser.description: Create a user for your organization.

DisableUser.description:
Disable a user. Can only be used with an application key belonging
to an administrator user.

GetUser.description: Get a user in the organization specified by the user’s `user_id`.

UpdateUser.description:
Edit a user. Can only be used with an application key belonging
to an administrator user.

ListUserOrganizations.description:
Get a user organization. Returns the user information and all organizations
joined by this user.

ListUserPermissions.description:
Get a user permission set. Returns a list of the user’s permissions
granted by the associated user's roles.
